class Solution:
    def minimumOperations(self, nums: List[int], target: List[int]) -> int: 
        lst=[]
        for x,y in zip(nums,target):
            lst.append(x-y)
        ans=0
        i=0
        cha=[lst[0]]
        for x,y in pairwise(lst):
            cha.append(y-x)
        # j=len(cha)-1
        # print(lst,cha)
        z=0;f=0
        for num in cha:
            if num>0:z+=num
            else:f-=num
        ans+=max(z,f)

        # while i<=j:
        #     while cha[i]==0:i+=1
        #     while cha[j]==0:j-=1
        #     if i>j:break
        #     if cha[i]*cha[j]<0:
        #         if abs(cha[i])>abs(cha[j]):
        #             ans+=abs(cha[j])
        #             cha[i]+=cha[j]
        #             j-=1
        #         else:
        #             ans+=abs(cha[i])
        #             cha[j]+=cha[i]
        #             i+=1
        #     else:
        #         if abs(cha[i])<abs(cha[j]):
        #             ans+=abs(cha[i])
        #             i+=1
        #         else:
        #             ans+=abs(cha[j])
        #             j-=1
        return ans
